title: Structured Simulation Training for Strengthening Scientific Decision-Making Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic social science knowledge and understanding of scientific inquiry methods
context.additional_context: Large-group activities and discussion-centered environments utilizing smartphone-based VR simulations

learning_goals: Learners can analyze social science issues from multiple perspectives and derive at least three decision-making criteria
Learners can evidence-based evaluate the pros and cons of alternatives based on scientific information and perform trade-off analysis
Learners can apply a structured decision-making process (problem definition → criteria setting → alternative evaluation → final selection) in a simulation environment

resources: Digital Whiteboard Tool for Collaborative Learning
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
